stories.text:
Today I was looking through Paul Grahams essays again. I find this format of writing very appealing. One topic per short text.

Then I realized that PG is the only one who's essays I read.

There must be so many more!

Can HN suggest some?

I wrote "essay writers" rather than "bloggers" because somehow I fear that bloggers have a different approach to writing. Something like "Hey fans, I have not written something for 3 days now. Sorry for that! Let me tell you about the great lasagna I cooked today ...".

What I am looking for is pieces of text someone has worked hard on because they had the feeling they have something meaningful to say.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some great essay writers other than Paul Graham?

stories.text: Sometimes doing a thing one way is just common sense, but most of the time there is some innovation involved, e.g. GrapheneOS malloc. The code is covered by license, but are design decisions? Especially given the fact, that they were openly discussed before the code was written?
stories.title: Ask HN: Are architecture design decisions covered by project license?
